IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Inglis House operates a 297-bed nursing facility for people with severe physical disabilities irrespective of their ability to pay.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Inglis Foundation's mission is to enable people with disabilities-and those who care for them-to achieve their goals and live life to the fullest. Our mission is accomplished through a range of programs, facilities and strategic initiatives designed to empower adults (ages 18 and older) with severe physical disabilities. Founded in 1877, Inglis Foundation is a national leader in providing comprehensive care and services for people with multiple sclerosis, cerebral palsy, spinal cord and other neurological disorders. Inglis supports its consumers with 24 hour care at Inglis House, a 297 bed skilled nursing facility; across southeastern Pennsylvania through 160 affordable, accessible apartments in PA and NJ; and in the community through our Care Management; Adult Day and Employment Services Programs.
IRS990.Description: Inglis House offers adult residents a full range of physical, occupational and speech therapies; social enrichment programs including computer and education programs, vocational rehabilitation and religious programs in a vibrant community characterized by respect and empowerment for each member. The age of residents is 52 who live at Inglis for an average length of stay of 10.2 years, with a waiting list of over 24 months for admission. In 2010 Inglis was designated as a Center for the Promotion of Excellence in Long Term Care by the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. Only eight other organizations have earned this designation.The new Inglis Collaborative was initiated to begin data collection, research and best practices sharing among peer institutions to improve understanding, capabilities and outcomes for the unique population served by Inglis and our collaborative partners.The Awards for Continuing Excellence (ACE) program, now in its 6th year, honors the outstanding performance of other organizations serving people with disabilities throughout the Delaware Valley. Five organizations received awards in 2010 and continued Inglis' goal of sharing best practices regionally and nationally. A total of 37 organizations have received ACE awards since the program's inception.The Inglis Community is supported by an active network of volunteers including many regional college and university students, faith based groups and dedicated individuals who provide programmatic support and encouragement to residents. In FY 2010 volunteers provided over 16,700 hours of service.Inglis Community Employment Services (ICES) provided assessment, training, adaptive computer equipment, job coaching and placement for residents and clients to be a vital part of the regional work force. In FY 2010, an average of 25 people a month received job placements and 1,273 hours of job coaching and training were provided. Inglis has received a grant from the PA Department of Labor and Industry to grow the program and increase job placement.The Inglis Community Reentry Program helps residents prepare to live independently in the community. The six step program provides practical experiences that train residents in the skills they need to lead safe and successful independent lives. Occupancy in Inglis' 160 housing units is 97.2% for FY2010.The Inglis House Resident Computer Lab provides a vital connection for Inglis residents and Adult Day clients to access technology for social contacts, recreation and educational purposes. In FY 2010, about 50% of residents used the Computer Lab regularly, logging approximately 2,500 hours per month. Many other residents have personal computers in their rooms and receive additional assistance from Inglis staff. The Lab received a Philadelphia Access Achievement Award for the Mayor's Commission on People with Disabilities in 2010.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Inglis follows the provisions of the income tax standard regarding the recognition and measurement of uncertain tax positions. The application of these provisions has no impact on the Organization's financial statements. Inglis income tax returns are subject to review and examination by federal, state, and local authorities. Inglis is not aware of any activities that would jeopardize its tax-exempt status. Inglis is not aware of any activities that are subject to tax on unrelated business income or excise or other taxes. The tax returns for the years 2007 to 2009 are open to examination by federal, local, and state authorities.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Part I, Line 4a: Mario Porro received severance payments totaling $52,492 during fiscal year 2010 from Inglis Foundation (a related organization).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The prepared 990 was reviewed by the Audit and Compliance Committee and provided to each member of the board of directors prior to being filed with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All employees of Inglis Foundation and related entities must ensure that customer care and business activities are conducted in an objective manner and are not motivated by desire for personal or financial gain. All employees are required to disclose any actual or potential conflict of interest to his or her manager, human resources or the Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer for appropriate determination and resolution. In addition, all directors, officers, members of Committees with board-delegated powers and all senior managers must complete a Conflict of Interest Affirmation of Compliance and Disclosure Statement upon hiring, on an annual basis, and when a potential conflict of interest arises. The Foundation's Committee on the Board has responsibility for reviewing the disclosure statements and enforcing the policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: An independent firm presents findings to the Board of Trustees for approval of compensation package for CEO and senior management team.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes the governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Oversight Committee of the audit and financial statements:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization has a committee that oversees the audit of its financial statements as well as the selection of an independent auditor. This has not changed since prior year.
